intro: Oxytropis lunelliana, commonly known as the Sierra foothill milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale purple or white in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis lunelliana is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers.
